void.string: His Excellency, Mr StÃ©phane Romatet, Ambassador of France to Australia launches the 'Food and Water Security Shaping Land-Use Futures' forum held at The Australian National University on 12 June 2013 as part of the French-Australian Water and Land Management Initiative. The aim of the forum is to share experiences on water and food security in relation to land-use management in France and Australia and regions of mutual interest, including the Asia-Pacific and Africa, as well as to discuss how Franco-Australian cooperation in this domain can be further enhanced. The official opening session will include a panel discussion between French and Australian participants on the global challenges of food and water security shaping land-use futures and perspectives for collaboration. Financial and in-kind support for this second forum of the French-Australian Water and Land Management Initiative is gratefully acknowledged, including from: The French Embassy in Australia; l'Institut FranÃ§ais; the ANU College of Arts and Social Sciences; IRSTEA, France; the ANU Water Initiative; the ANU Centre for European Studies and the CSIRO. The initiative was developed in collaboration with the French Embassy in Australia is co-convened by the ANU (Dr Katherine Daniell and Prof Quentin Grafton) and IRSTEA (Dr Olivier Barreteau). The first forum was held in June 2011 in Montpellier, France. viewcount:0 Time:null

His Excellency, Mr StÃ©phane Romatet, Ambassador of France to Australia launches the 'Food and Water Security Shaping Land-Use Futures' forum held at The Australian National University on 12 June 2013 as part of the French-Australian Water and Land Management Initiative. The aim of the forum is to share experiences on water and food security in relation to land-use management in France and Australia and regions of mutual interest, including the Asia-Pacific and Africa, as well as to discuss how Franco-Australian cooperation in this domain can be further enhanced. The official opening session will include a panel discussion between French and Australian participants on the global challenges of food and water security shaping land-use futures and perspectives for collaboration. Financial and in-kind support for this second forum of the French-Australian Water and Land Management Initiative is gratefully acknowledged, including from: The French Embassy in Australia; l'Institut FranÃ§ais; the ANU College of Arts and Social Sciences; IRSTEA, France; the ANU Water Initiative; the ANU Centre for European Studies and the CSIRO. The initiative was developed in collaboration with the French Embassy in Australia is co-convened by the ANU (Dr Katherine Daniell and Prof Quentin Grafton) and IRSTEA (Dr Olivier Barreteau). The first forum was held in June 2011 in Montpellier, France.
French Australian forum on water and land management
